Package template

Class Util

java.lang.Object
template.Util
public class Util extends Object
Utility class, supporting the project with several static methods and constants.

  • Method Details

    • appendColumns

      public static void appendColumns(StringBuilder sb, String text, int index, int nrOfcolumns, String speparator, int minColLength)
      Appends a newline or the separator string before appending the text, depending on the index and nrOfcolumns.
      Use: to write lists and add newlines if lines get too long.
      Parameters:
      sb - a StringBuilder to store the text items
      text - the text to append
      index - the index, usually taken from a for() loop
      nrOfcolumns - the number of columns of a line
      speparator - a string separating the columns
      minColLength - a text of a length less than minColLength will be extended to minColLength using the space character

    • createDateAndTimeStamp

      public static String createDateAndTimeStamp()
      Creates a date and time stamp (without milliseconds) as a String.
      Returns:
      the time stamp string

    • createStringOf

      public static String createStringOf(int count, String s)
      Creates a string by repeating another string, which may be a single character. Example: createStringOf(50, "*");
      Parameters:
      count - the number of repeating
      s - the string to be repeated
      Returns:
      the repeated result string

    • createTimeStamp

      public static String createTimeStamp()
      Creates a time stamp (without milliseconds, without date) as a String.
      Returns:
      the time stamp string

    • createFilenameFilterStartingWith

      public static FilenameFilter createFilenameFilterStartingWith(String fileNamePrefix)
      Creates a FilenameFilter for files that start with a given prefix.
      Parameters:
      fileNamePrefix - the prefix a file has to start with
      Returns:
      the FilenameFilter

    • findFilesStartingWith

      public static String[] findFilesStartingWith(File parentDirectory, String fileNamePrefix)
      Returns a String array for all files in a directory that start with a given prefix.
      Parameters:
      parentDirectory - the parent directory
      fileNamePrefix - the prefix a file has to start with
      Returns:
      the String array with the file names

    • listToString

      public static String listToString(List<? extends Object> list, String separator)
      Returns String of all integer elements of an List, separated by another (separation) String (e.g. a space).
      Parameters:
      list - the List of the integer elements
      separator - a separator
      Returns:
      the resulting string

    • prompt

      public static String prompt(String text)
      Prompts for a text message in the System.out window, blocks until the user types RETURN/ENTER and returns the string typed in. This method intentionally encapsulates possible exceptions.
      Parameters:
      text - the text string to be displayed
      Returns:
      a String containing the input

    • readFromUrl

      public static String readFromUrl(String urlString) throws Exception
      Reads the contents of an URL into a String object.
      Note: this is a very simple wget.
      Parameters:
      urlString - the URL to read from
      Returns:
      the contents of the URL
      Throws:
      Exception - in case of unexpected exceptions

    • renameToBackupFile

      public static void renameToBackupFile(String filename, String backupFilename) throws IOException
      Renames a file to a backup file, if the file exists . If an old backup file exists already, it will be deleted before renaming the file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to rename
      backupFilename - the name of the backup file
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of exception

    • sleep

      public static void sleep(long millis)
      Convenience method for Thread.sleep(millis).
      Note: the thread calling this method will sleep, a (unlikely) happening InterruptedException is ignored, but the stack trace is printed.
      Parameters:
      millis - the milliseconds to sleep

    • stackTraceToString

      public static String stackTraceToString(Throwable e)
      Returns the stack trace of an Exception as a string.
      Parameters:
      e - the Exception
      Returns:
      the stack trace as String

    • stringParam

      public static String stringParam(String string, Object... args)
      Replaces parameter arguments of "$(N)" in a string and returns the result. Note: N has to be an integer and counts from one to N. 
      
 Example:
   String s = stringParam("I can feel $(2) disturbance in the $(1)", "force", 1);
   results in "I can feel 1 disturbance in the force".
      Parameters:
      string - the string (with 0..N parameters)
      args - a bunch of arguments (...), 0..N replacement objects
      Returns:
      the replaced result string

    • toLength

      public static String toLength(String text, int length)
      Expands a String object to a given length, either by cutting the string or by extending it with spaces.
      Use: create output with fix-sized columns.
      Parameters:
      text - the string
      length - length to expand or cut
      Returns:
      the resulting string

    • toStringPercent

      public static String toStringPercent(double value)
      Returns a string of % from a double value.
      Parameters:
      value - the double value
      Returns:
      a string of %

    • writeFile

      public void writeFile(String fileName, String content) throws IOException
      Writes the content of a String object to a file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the file to write on
      content - the content of the file to write
      Throws:
      IOException - in case of unexpected exceptions

    • verbose

      public static void verbose(String text)
      Do System.out.println of a text string to console, if the verbose flag property is on (default).
      Parameters:
      text - the text string to be displayed
